H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2620.def: = action by which humans and animals who find themselves in difficult circumstances go to a certain location, ► in order to find protection or safety

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H6403.def: = process by which humans find safety from a dangerous or life-threatening situation

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H4583.def: = a location that deities, humans or animals have made their dwelling place; ≈ associated with security

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H6403.def: = process by which humans find safety from a dangerous or life-threatening situation

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4009.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

H5564.def: = action by which humans put their hand(s) on another human, an animal, or an object ► often as a ritual before sacrifice or a sign of authority or punishment

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H1491.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = causative action by which someone removes part of a previously integrated unit

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H4578.def: literally =  the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion

H8416.def: = action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do

H4159.def: = object or event that reminds of something that has happened or as a confirmation of something that is yet to happen

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H5797.def: = state in which an object is able to withstand force

H4268.def: = location where one goes to find protection or safety; ◄ because of difficult circumstances

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H8416.def: = action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

2.gl: to be filled > to be engaged

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H2209.def: = state in which a human being is nearing the end of a long life; ≈ and is not able to perform certain functions

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3289.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H2439.def: = process by which an event happens quickly

H5833.def: = action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non-military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H5844.def: = causative action by which someone puts an object on top of or in front of something else

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H3639.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3176.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H8416.def: = action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H8668.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue of humans in need

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H5615.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = the frequency with which an event of a particular kind occurs

H1369.def: = the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3925.def: = process by which humans or animals acquire knowledge or skill from an identified or unidentified source, ► which usually results in a specific behavior or skill

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H6381.def: = state in which an event is out of the ordinary, inspiring amazement, and usually associated with the supernatural

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H2209.def: = state in which a human being is nearing the end of a long life; ≈ and is not able to perform certain functions

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H4791.def: = a position of a relatively high elevation above the earth

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H8415.def: = great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H1420.def: = state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H5437.def: = process by which a door is attached to a wall by means of a {L:hinge<SDBH:צִיר>}, or a contraption with a similar function, which allows it to pivot

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3034.def: literally: to confess (God's) name; hence: = action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H5035.def: = container ◄ made of a goatskin, the outer side of which has been turned inside; ► used for storing wine

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H2167.def: = action by which one expresses one's respect and gratitude to someone else by uttering words at a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not

H3658.def: = musical instrument consisting of a sound box ◄ made of wood, out of the ends or sides of which projected two arms; the arms supported a crosspiece; strings descended from the crosspiece over the sound box and the number of strings could vary; ► often used to accompany singing

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H2167.def: = action by which one expresses one's respect and gratitude to someone else by uttering words at a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H6299.def: = causative action by which humans exchange animals or other humans by substituting them with money or with an(other) animal, ► as a result of which they will escape death or slavery

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H1897.def: = causative action by which humans causes other humans or objects to be removed from their place,◄ as if by blowing them away

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H2659.def: = action by which animals strike the ground with their feet
